parameters.definition: Total factory space in square feet
Labor hours required to produce one phone
Labor hours required to produce one laptop
Cost per square foot of space for phone production
Cost per square foot of space for laptop production
Net revenue per square foot from phone production
Net revenue per square foot from laptop production

description: A suspicious factory has \param{S} sq. feet of space. It makes bootleg phones and laptops. Phones require \param{LPhone} hours of labor and cost \param{CPhone} for each sq. foot of space allocated for phone production (cost of electricity and equipment). Laptops require \param{LLaptop} hours of labor and cost \param{CLaptop} for each sq. foot of space allocated for laptop production. Phones produce a net revenue of \param{RPhone} per sq. foot while laptops produce a net revenue of \param{RLaptop} per sq. foot. The factory wants to spend at most \param{BudgetMax} and \param{LaborMax} hours of labor. What is the optimal factory layout to maximize revenue?
